clinical_study.brief_title: Post Trial Analysis of a Primary Prevention Study in Asian Indians
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Information Technology in the Prevention of Type 2 Diabetes - An Extended Follow-up Study

lead_sponsor.agency: India Diabetes Research Foundation & Dr. A. Ramachandran's Diabetes Hospitals

clinical_study.source: India Diabetes Research Foundation & Dr. A. Ramachandran's Diabetes Hospitals

brief_summary.textblock: An extended follow-up study of NCT00819455 conducted 5 years post randomization. In this study we estimate the incidence of type 2 diabetes among participants enrolled in the diabetes prevention programme. This will provide comparison of the progression to diabetes among group motivated through text messages and the group educated only during enrollment. A total of 537 participants were enrolled in the primary study and are invited to participate in a follow-up visit 3 years post active trial period.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of type 2 diabetes among participants enrolled in the diabetes prevention programme.

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term impact of healthy lifestyle through mobile phone based text messaging

arm_group.description: Participants in the intervention group received periodic text messages on healthy lifestyle throughout the study period.
Participants in the control group received standard one time advice at entry in the study.

intervention.intervention_name: Text Messaging via Short Message Service

biospec_descr.textblock: Serum and blood cells are stored.

study_pop.textblock: Participants randomized (n=537) in the primary study NCT00819455.
